title: Pretty in Any Color: Women on the Court Make the Style Rules
abstract: Players in women’s basketball are styling themselves how they want, because they can. Their choices also can be lucrative.

abstract: Vingegaard, 25 and a professional cyclist for only three years, held an insurmountable lead as the Tour prepared to roll into Paris.

title: A Powerhouse Team of Stars, Ring or No Ring
abstract: With Jim Kaat and Tony Oliva set for Hall of Fame induction, the Minnesota Twins of the 1960s and ’70s will shine in Cooperstown despite no World Series titles.

multimedia.caption: The 1965 Twins featured multiple future Hall of Famers, including Jim Kaat and Tony Oliva. The team also had Zoilo Versalles, who won the A.L.’s Most Valuable Player Award that year.

title: Representing a Nation on TV, and a Running Team on Instagram
abstract: Distance running is a relentlessly individual sport. But professional running teams, and their polished Instagram accounts, are upending that dynamic.

title: N.B.A. Mostly Keeps Low Profile in Public Campaign to Free Brittney Griner
abstract: Griner, the W.N.B.A. star, has been detained in Russia since February. The N.B.A., which founded the women’s league in 1996, has said it is working behind the scenes to help Griner.

multimedia.caption: N.B.A. Commissioner Adam Silver said the league was using its influence to help Brittney Griner, but “ultimately this is a matter to be resolved by the United States government.”

abstract: New rules, new science and new tactics are already beginning to push heading out of the game. But doing so could have unintended consequences.

title: Amid Sri Lanka’s Crisis, Cricket Carries On
abstract: The success of the men’s national team has offered solace to the country, and one fan called the players “brand ambassadors during this time of hardship.”

title: You Might Be a Hall of Famer, but Do You Have a Statue?
abstract: Baseball’s Hall of Famers all have plaques in Cooperstown, but only some of them have been honored with statues. And they won’t let Dave Winfield forget that.

abstract: On Sunday, seven former players, including David Ortiz of the Red Sox, will be inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame.

title: Nolan Ryan Had a Softer Side. He Just Hid It (Very) Well.
abstract: A new documentary explores the unique challenge of facing Ryan, the game’s most prolific strikeout artist, but also shows off a gentler version of the Ryan Express.

title: Magnus Carlsen Is Giving Up His World Title. Replacing Him Won’t Be Easy.

title: Uwe Seeler, One of Germany’s Greatest Soccer Players, Dies at 85
